Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: kristiben
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Soho. The rooms and service were fantastic! They even sent a card and a treat up our first night because it was our anniversary. It was a really great experience. Thank you Soho Met!

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: ken031
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay at the SOHO Met almost every time we are in Toronto which is 7 or 8 times per year. The hotel is always great. The rooms are very nice, modern and classy. The hotel is a block off King St W so it is in the heart of the entertainment district and close to lots of restaurants and activities. On our most recent stay, we were there for two nights in their Executive Suite which is 1 bedroom plus a living room which has a pull out couch for our daughter. We are greeted by name when we come into the hotel, and the concierge knows his stuff. Lots of good restaurant recommendations. This is the first time we can say the bed was not comfortable. Every other time it has been great. But this would be our only complaint We have stayed at the Four Seasons and the Windsor Arms as well. This is on par with the Windsor Arms and better than the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dubbs605
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly service, good location. Near king street and the CN tower. Sen5es restaurant in the hotel serves good food.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Nt555
Reviews.Content: Very nice bathroom. View wasn't great and the room was pretty small for a luxury

Reviews.Title: “wow !!!”
Reviews.Author: shoppinggirl43
Reviews.Content: Had a great night at the Soho. The room was modern and comfortable. The bathroom was fabulous including a heated floor and seperate shower and bath. Our room was right near the elevator and we didn't hear a thing outside our door. Overall a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: KGBRover
Reviews.Content: Hip hotel, yet very friendly to business. Have stayed now on three occasions and have liked every room so far. seems to be very wide range of prices, however, so future stays will be somewhat price dependent (most good downtown Toronto hotels can be pricy for week-day business stays - but I have found SoHo Met can be very reasonable one day and outrageous the next). Service is always top-notch, and rooms always clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and good location”
Reviews.Author: zola99
Reviews.Content: very cold out but really enjoyed the Soho Met, spent two nights for work so didnt experience the spa and restaurant but extremely comfortable and great location - would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family - 2 adults 2 kids”
Reviews.Author: angelainnewyork
Reviews.Content: We had to dash to Toronto on a visa run from NYC. We weren't sure how long it would take so I thought a kitchen would be handy. This place is perfect. Downtown location, amazing and friendly service - nothing too hard, a pool to keep the kids happy (although a little chilly for my taste), a nice gym and tasty room service. Even had a washer/dryer with supplied soap and dryer sheets. We stayed in a 1 br king suite with the kids on a sofa bed. There was plenty of room left with a dining table and desk. Only complaint ( and really just recommendation) was more hooks or towel rails. Otherwise ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: JuliaPSU
Reviews.Content: Very clean, classic and the bathroom was luxurious. We hope to visit and stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: Out of all the hotels I've had the pleasure of experiencing, this is one of my top favourites. From the ever attentive doormen and concierge to the quick and discreet front desk personnel, everything is enjoyable. But the best has to be the guestroom itself - a true work of art and a study in efficient and upscale boutique design - from the heated bathroom floor, deep soaker tub, large glass shower, unique and totally functionnal dressing area, to the comfortable king bed, great work desk and huge TV. Everything in working order and everything in its place ready to be enjoyed. Thank you everyone for another successful meeting after a great night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Compact luxury”
Reviews.Author: Kara_T_Newark
Reviews.Content: We loved the SoHo Metropolitan and stayed there Friday and Saturday nights. I am not one for fussy frills, and this hotel was clean, classic luxury. From the gorgeous blown glass flowers in the ceiling before the entrance, to the polished granite walls and floors and natural wood tones, it was beautiful. There appeared to be just a handful of other guests so it was very quiet. Our room faced an inner courtyard of sorts so no street noise. We saved a little money by parking in the pay lot directly across the street ($50 for w'end instead of $60-$75 at the hotel). The bedroom was a bit small but just fine for us. I loved the fawn colored velvet drapes with clean lines and the automatic open/close button for them by the bed. The bathroom was amazing as other reviewers had said. Granite and glass with a heated floor option and a floor light for a romantic bath. The closet area was like a walk in closet with blonde wood, a large mirror, and plenty of his/her space. Only downside was mattress was a bit creaky in one spot and one morning we heard squeal of water pipes briefly. We loved the breakfast buffet (a bit pricey at $22 but given how expensive Toronto is it was not so bad). They had a very limited amount of dim sum, made blueberry pancakes and great eggs (I had omelet with goat cheese and spinach), fantastic OJ, coffee and pastries. Good location with a brisk 10 min walk to subway. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMan3333
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved by one-night stay at this hotel! The room was a luxury room, with full marble bathroom, heated floors, nice bathtub, great couch and work area and LCD television. The curtains are on remote-controlled rollers and the window offered a great people-watching experience from the 2nd floor. I ordered room service from the restaurant downstairs, and although the food wasn't outstanding, service was fantastic and very prompt. I also used the wifi, and unlike most hotels, it was fast enough and strong enough to stream video online. Combined with its central location near the theatre district and Blue Jays Way, this was a great value (the room rate was in the $215 range). I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ah...the food!!!”
Reviews.Author: strongC
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel just for one night attending a conference. Dinner the evening before was decadent! Breakfast and lunch during the conference was equally sinful. Catering at this hotel DEFINITELY rocks! Was told it was highly sought after for Asian weddings and I can certainly see why! The location was great too! Will admit that my room was a little small but given that I just went there to sleep, it more than met my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel--Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Micht123
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in this part of Toronto, very close to the theater and many restaurants. I didn't like to wait for check in, but the room was pretty nice. It was my birthday and they sent up a little sweet. I thought that was nice. The view was of a parking lot and the carpet was dirty. I thought I was going to get an upgrade, but we didn't. The bathroom and the comfort of the bed were very nice and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience- and I'm a hard judge!”
Reviews.Author: ellagrace8
Reviews.Content: I researched a hotel in Toronto before going and was really stressed about it. I have to say, this turned out better than I could have imagined. I had a deluxe King room on the 4th floor. Despite the fact that the hotel rooms only go up to floor 4 ( I was worried about this because of noise- I'm a very light sleeper!!!!) the room was so quiet at night you could have heard a pin drop. The hotel is not on a main thoroughfare- and I heard no noise. I am not a good sleeper and I slept all 5 nights sound. The sheets and beds were extremely comfortable ( I have alot of joint problems so I'm picky) , clean and fresh. The room was extremely clean and felt more like being in your bedroom than a hotel room. ceiling details and art in the rooms helped with those touches. The bathroom was amazing!!!!! I'm always cold, so a heater in the bathroom with heated floors was a dream- truly! The bathroom was always extremely clean and the deep tub and shower were great. I will tell you that this room truly felt luxurious and not like an average hotel room. The service was truly wonderful and I'm a stickler for details. The greeters, concierage, restaurant staff and desk foks were extremely pleasant at all times and were extremely helpful finding /booking tickets, cars, etc. The food in the hotel was lovely- and I never usually eat in hotels, but it was rainy when we got in and gave it a try. It was great! You truly can't go wrong here. I would definitely book again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Peace, quiet & quality.....”
Reviews.Author: serenity4me83
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© & I traveled at the end of June 2011. We were in town for a concert. I'm glad we chose the Soho Met for our accommodations. The service was great, the room was perfect -especially the huge windows with electric curtains & the heated marble floors in the bathroom. We ate from Pizza Rustica across the street twice and both times it was absolutely wonderful. I had the ravioli both times and when we return I'll have it again! Back to the hotel, everyone was kind (always greeting us (the doormen were nice) the room was nice & comfortable and we will definitely be returning. Also the restaurant downstairs was really good....

Reviews.Title: “One of my top 3 hotels worldwide”
Reviews.Author: gootandcat
Reviews.Content: I'm on the road internationally 60% of the time so get to stay in endless 5 star hotels. I took an apartment at the Soho - fantastic experience. The staff are amazingly helpful and nice too. The bar is great and the little snacks are superb - those mini choc brulees are irresistable and good wine selection. The restaurant is good too but the local area is jammed with great places to eat. Well located near the Bay, CN tower, the concert hall, great restaurants etc. The apartment room was not only inexpensive but superb - I had the 1 bedroom apartment with 2 LCD TVs, lovely bed nice bathroom. I stayed there 8 weeks over 3 trips and looked forward to coming back. The icing on the cake on this hotel, if you like that sort of thing, is that many celebs stay there when doing concerts. The did have to clear the restaurant for Lady Gaga but that was not trouble and her style of dress that night compensated. Endless list of other celebs too - 10cents, Beyonce, etc etc. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “SOHO: Simply Outstanding HOtel.”
Reviews.Author: FlexitarianCouple
Reviews.Content: CHECKING IN: The front desk area was very neat and tidy. Our front desk agent was very courteous and the check-in process went smoothly. ROOM: Simply amazing. The sitting area and bathroom are separated from the bedroom by large sliding doors. There was a mini-bar with plenty of stock, and if you wanted to take the stuff out and use it as a fridge, it's easy to do as itâ€™s not weight censored (at least our wasnâ€™t). The entrance was very spacious with a place to sit and put your shoes on, very nice! Safe provided in a closet along with usual hotel amenities such as hair dryer. Bathroom: heated floor, floor light (great as a night light), large vanity area, shower separate from large soaker tub. Robes and slippers provided were a great addition. Sitting Area: A nice comfy couch with a coffee table and tv directly in front; great sitting area. A desk and chair are also provided for working and are located in a manner that makeâ€™s seeing the tv very easy. Bedroom: I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever slept with more comfortable sheets! Holy Boy they were awesome! There were light switches to turn on the bathroom light, to open/close drapes as well, and another flat screen tv to watch if desired. There was turn down service provided and they put a towel at the foot of your bed so you donâ€™t have to walk around on the hotel carpet with bare feet. Sweet! GYM: Great, many modern machines, dumbbells, smith machine, medicine balls and universal system with cable pulleys. Could also use the sun-deck to work out which allows for doing walking lunges, among other things. POOL: A decent lap pool, not deep, maybe 4 feet? HOT TUB: The tub was a great size, jets were fairly powerful, however, they weren't very well located as you could only get a jet up over the mid-back, not hitting the shoulders and also making it difficult to massage low-back. If the Jets were staggered this would improve the hot tub immensely. LOCATION: The hotel was in a great location. A pizzeria (Pizza Rustica) and breakfast diner (Cora's) are directly across the street. See our reviews of those two places as well. Itâ€™s a five minute walk to the Rogers Centre. Ample parking options are available either with the hotel or another of several nearby lots. One downside is the noise from the courtyard we heard. There was a party going on right under our window on the ground floor (we were 4 floors up). We only heard them twice, but could hear them nonetheless. Better windows might help, not sure. It wasn't that big of a deal but I could see this causing some issues for some. We typically stay at the Sheraton Centre every summer, however, weâ€™ll be looking at staying at the Soho if the price fits. We got a deal through wagjag/jaunt, so Iâ€™m not sure we could justify the regular room rate otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “SOHO Metropolitan through Wagjag.com”
Reviews.Author: PamGurdHughes
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the hotel while looking to buy a condo in Toronto. The hotel accommodated us with an early check-in which was greatly appreciated. The suite had a king-size bed with built in drawers with a TV along with bath robes. The living area had a TV, desk, chair, coffee table, and sofa as well as corner huge windows. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous with tub and large shower. Under ground parking was also available. The location was excellent and close to stores, restaurants, and subway station. Our hotel package included two complimentary small dessert cakes and two complimentary drinks at the bar. I am a chocolate nut and these mouse cakes were the best ever. The presentation was excellent with chocolate syrup shaped leaves on the plate. Linen serviettes as well as cutlery were also provided. The hotel bar has a lovely ambiance and you have a choice of sitting at the bar or in a lounge setting with chairs and sofas, or at tables. I had an apple martini and my partner had a pomegranate martini. His martini was delicious while mine was below average; however, I did drink it. The staff was excellent and very helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I would recommend it too.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sdkphd
Reviews.Content: Loved the room especially the bathroom. Contemporary, clean, wonderful conveniences including electronic shades and lights. Swivel flat panel TV on the wall for viewing from sofa or bed. Fantastic amount of closet space. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly and I received a letter from the manager acknowledging the special appreciation i wrote for the concierge, Xavier.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the splurge!!!”
Reviews.Author: Racquel P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights to get a feel for the city before staying in the suburbs with the family. I hesitated at first because the city of Toronto is quite expensive. I am so glad that I did though!!! The hotel was in a great location. The whole staff was very helpful. The concierge had great recommendations not only for fine dining but also good affordable places to eat. Love, love, love the huge bathroom and the huge closet space. Love the heated bathroom floor too!!! And Molton Brown toiletries, need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PicturesqueTraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice place...my partner and I went to toronto for our anniversary...she picked this hotel but I would highly recommend it. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was exquisite. Robes and slippers provided, bottle of water every night by the bed side, electronic drapes, multiple light controls around the room. Very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “friendly service”
Reviews.Author: foxy90
Reviews.Content: We had a deal through travelzoo....the front desk made our bill in error $400 error. You'd think they would be up on the deal and not needing to be reminded. They weren't on the ball that way. Other than that, it was a great location. Right near the Rogers Center. 5 floors. We were on the top floor looking towards the Rogers Center and onto a parking lot, but it is right downtown. It is clean, modern. The maids knocked on the door to see if you needed turn down service. They were friendly as well as the bell man and others. The Senses restaraunt was excellent! The beef tenderloin, scallops and lemon honey salad was delicious!!!! The Cora Restaraunt is located right across the street for an easy morning breakfast if you do not go to there restaraunt bakery. The Kensington Market is very close, however they didn't seem to be opened very early compared to the St.Lawrence which is much further away. Parking is 30.00 underground which is right next door. The parking lot as i mentioned right across the road was going to charge us 50.00 overnight and part of the next day? There sign had different prices???? Valet parking is 35.00.Overall pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: mtn-ldy
Reviews.Content: We often travel to Toronto for a fun weekend away, and we're going to stay here from now on. The rooms are well laid-out, with modern furnishings, Frette linens and robes and very comfortable beds. The bathrooms are spectacular with heated marble floors, separate deep soaker-tubs, glassed-in showers, and very nice amenities. The on-site restaurant and bar is very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, delicious food, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Gypsi_love
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the food was delicious but the staff for the hotel, in particular the front desk, were unpleasant, pretentious and discourteous. They made me feel unwelcome and talked down to me in a demeaning way. I had used a Travel Zoo voucher that included both room and $150 credit at their restaurant, Senses. From presentation of the voucher the staff treated me unkindly, and made me feel unequal to guests without the voucher. I would never come to this hotel again because of the way the front desk had treated me. The staff at both Senses bakery and restaurant on the other hand were wonderful. I was unhappy to find out that the only menu available was a condensed version of the original due to Summerlicious butI was surprised by the exotic ingredients and beautiful presentation for the reduced price menu. The staff at the restaurant were wonderful and continually checked to see if we were enjoying everything and food and drink were prompt and frequently refilled. I would suggest to people to definitely come to the restaurant but I discourage you to stay at the hotel, I know I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! Great location! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Newfee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our early 30's and decided to stay in this hotel even though we live in Toronto! We got a great deal through a group deal website and we would do it again in a heartbeat. We were looking for a way to spend our anniversary and this place did not let us down. Check in was a breeze and we got a room 2 hours before check-in time. We were offered late check out and stayed 2 hours past check-out time. Room was clean, modern and spacious. We had a view facing the CN tower which was nice. Food at the Senses restaurant was out of this world. Pricey yes, but huge portions and amazing quality. Will go back again for sure. Hotel is located right next to Cora's where we ate breakfast the next morning - great place if you haven't been there! All the staff we encountered were very helpful and courteous. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Great location and walking distance to everything Toronto has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: missmeimei
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Soho Met for one night to celebrate our anniversary. We wanted a quiet, modern hotel with a boutique feel. We were very impressed by the attentive and polite service as soon as we arrived. When we pulled up our car to the front entrance, the concierge immediately helped us with our luggage and assisted us with the queue. Check-in was fine, although we had to wait about 20 minutes for our room to be ready. During our wait, we had a quick snack at Senses Bakery, which was a little expensive - one glass of wine, a slice of cheesecake and cafe latte cost a total of $30. Valet service, which costs $35 per night, was seamless. We got room #325. The view was a little disappointing overlooking a parking lot; however, we were happy with the modern decor and the washroom was fabulous. The washroom was enormous taking up half the room, featured stunning marble with heated floors, large bathtub and glass shower stall. Bathroom amenities were high-quality and plentiful. There was also a large open-concept closet area between the washroom and bed, which had a generous amount of hanger and shelf space. The minibar was well-stocked. The bed was very comfortable. There was turndown service in the evening, although there were no customary chocolates left on the bed. Either the walls were very thick, or there was no one staying next to us, because our room was extremely quiet - loved it! Unfortunately, the drapes were broken so we could not close them (some issue with the electrical switch). We informed the front desk and they had someone close them for us. However, we then could not open them. It was clear that this was a chronic problem in this room because the switch plate was very worn out, indicating several attempts had been made to repair the switch - obviously without success! Also, the switch operating the nightstand lights did not work. We had to unscrew the bulbs to turn off the lights. I think it must have been due to the same electrical issue as with the drapes. The pool was nice, and had a very large hot tub. The gym looked well-equipped. Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay. We would definitely stay here again. The Soho Met is quiet and luxurious, and the service was excellent. However, due to the electrical issues in the room and the fact we received no compensation upon checkout, I am rating the Soho Met 4/5 instead of 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto downtown area - Soho Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: TripMaster2011
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Soho Metropolitan for three nights and our experience was great. This hotel/residence is perfectly located in downtown Toronto area. Just a block from the hotel you can ride street cars (aka tram) which will connect you to cityâ€™s subways and major attraction. Hotel staff including concierge was very pleasant and helpful. Room itself had upscale look and feel with high ceiling, mechanical drapes, modern entertainment equipments plus ample space for unpacking and cabinets for keeping your clothes etc. Marble Bathroom was specious with heated floor (that was really good). Hotel has great gym and pool. I will recommend this hotel to business travelers as well as families.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back today if I could”
Reviews.Author: seanallan
Reviews.Content: We had the change to stay at the SoHo and wow this place is great all I have to say is if u can book there please do u well love it

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding boutique hotel-my new Toronto favorite”
Reviews.Author: wilson17
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed just about everything in this hotel. The lobby is very nice, with an efficient friendly check-in and helpful bell staff. The room had a beautiful marble bathroom (my shower was ample size and easy to enter), great bed and pillows, big lcd TV with a great picture, and easy to connect reliable high speed internet. It was on the second floor, so the big window didn't give much of a view, but the hotel seems to only have rooms up to the third floor. We had a meeting in their 7th floor meeting room that did have a great view (attached residence building). Although I didn't try the restaurant, the breakfast and lunch buffets at the meeting were excellent, notably better than the usual hotel meeting food. One small problem, although the room internet worked seamlessly and well, the meeting room router required multiple resets all morning (it finally worked consistently in the afternoon). Check out was easy, and they instantly extended to 1pm when asked. Overall a great, albeit short experience.

Reviews.Title: “Too many limitations. Won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: kasoufs
Reviews.Content: We had a special from Travelzoo that we booked which gave us an upgrade to the luxury room (which had a king bed, full marble bathroom with heated floors, soaker tub, separate shower, nice amenities...TV wasn't great - looked like an older HD TV but picture was terrible) and $150 credit to the Spa or the Senses restaurant. We went on a Sunday so it was $300 for the deal instead of $275 as advertised. We chose the restaurant for the credit, but the restaurant was closed on Sunday and Monday. Our food credit was still good for the Senses Bar (not for alcohol, tips and taxes though), Senses Bakery (later told that it was not good for any of the desserts at the Bakery, only the buffet or continental breakfast - but they made an exception when we expressed our displeasure and that we were informed that we COULD use it for the desserts as well), and the In-room Dining from Senses (which is an extra $5 delivery charge and 17% gratuity). The food was great, the service at the Bar and Bakery were great, the concierge service was great, but the limitations were annoying. We wanted to take a dip in the pool later in the evening but found out it was only open until 8 pm on weekends - but 10 pm during the week?? Doesn't make sense. Value for the money wasn't the greatest and the experience wasn't the greatest. If they eliminate all the limitations on the deal as well as make the restaurant available every day and the pool open til 10 every night then it would have been better. (ratings for pool and restaurant are only low because they weren't available at the time to us) We won't be staying there again...even if Madonna and Jay-Z stay there when they're in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “$60.00 Parking bill?!?!”
Reviews.Author: LGtravels85
Reviews.Content: The SoHo is a nice hotel, in a great location and we did get a good deal online. The room was clean and modern - nothing to write home about, but definitely nice. The bathroom looked beautiful, however, the big walk-in-shower door was installed in such a fashion that you had to trap yourself into the corner to get into it. I SINCERELY hope this is the case with our hotel room only, because if you are heavier set, you will NOT get into the shower. It was a tight squeeze for my both my boyfriend and I, and we are both fit. The next shock came with parking - we had been told it was $30 for overnight parking. Not a problem, and reasonable in compairison to many other Toronto hotels. When we inserted our ticket to the automated pay machine, we found that our bill was $60! We went to the front desk to find out why we were being charged SO much, and were told that $30 covers your first 24 hours of parking, and you are charged $6 per HALF HOUR to a maximum of $30 afterwards. Since we had decided to go the baseball game the following afternoon, and parked for a total of 28 hours, we had to pay an extra $30 dollar charge. The explanation we received was delivered in such a rude-arrogant demeanor it was infuriating. I have never been talked down too by a hotel staff member, and it was so off-putting I will never return to this hotel again. There are plenty of other nicer hotels in Toronto, for equivalent or cheaper price (not even taking into account parking), and the staff are much friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Writer57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last year - over a weekend and meant to submit a review earlier - the suites are amazing - basically you have your own apartment for your stay - clean, quiet and great location.

Reviews.Title: “So much comfort”
Reviews.Author: BobandCorey
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms amazing staff amazing bar....Thanks to Anjie ...Elena and Ben for making my stay at the SOHO MET one to remember...i will be back. PS try the Super Sonic Gin and Tonic a great night cap. Bob

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in a bedroom.”
Reviews.Author: MustLoveChis
Reviews.Content: The room was large, modern, clean. Comforter was plush and nice and quite Dakening blinds helps after a late night. Location is great walking distance to Air Canada. Right across the street is fantastic Pizzeria Rustica. Yum and good prices. And also across the street a breakfast spot. We only stayed the one night before heading to see family. But would do again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are travelling as a couple to escape life... hide out at the SOHO Metropolitan.”
Reviews.Author: AmyWasHere
Reviews.Content: Eight years ago, I was in Toronto on business and walked by the Sen5es Bakery inside the SOHO Met and decided to take a look inside. The hotel lobby was so beautiful and inviting, I asked for a tour of the rooms. I was impressed with the rooms an vowed I'd be back someday to stay there. Fast Forward eight years....My husband and I were in desperate need of a getaway weekend, and I had been thinking of the SOHO Met. I didn't remember the exact details about the hotel, but I remembered my vow to myself, so we booked a room for the weekend. My memory served me correctly. The SOHO Met is just as luxurious as I remembered. The service was exceptional. The concierge got us reservations at the restaurant atop the CN Tower on Valentine's weekend with only a few hours notice. The Sen5es bakery cooked us breakfast after the breakfast hours eneded just because we were hungry for breakfast. The room was exceptional. We walked into the room and classical music was playing to greet us. The linens were soft, the pillows fluffy and the bed comfortable. The decor was beautiful and modern. The bathroom was my favorite part. The floors were heated and there was both a tub and large shower. The amenities were by Moulton Brown, which are such a treat I couldn't leave them behind. We had a fabulous time seeing Toronto, but we loved coming back to our room to relax just as much. If you want to stay in luxury and be treated like someone special, stay at the SOHO Metropolitan.

Reviews.Title: “A little noise”
Reviews.Author: urufenta
Reviews.Content: Location is good for the entertainment area of Toronto, room layout and amenities are excellent, parking maybe cheaper in the lot across the street. Noise coming from the room next door (or was it outside the room?) woke me up in the middle of the night. Maybe sound insulation is not as good (?) . Otherwise we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: inhamilton
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel- very clean and the fine dining restaurant was fabulous- pricing by fine dining standards in Toronto in accord with top places- food and restaurant service top notch- you must try the truffle fries with a good glass of red wine- amazing!!!!!!!!!!!\\ We were put off by the volume of the music in the bar- could have been relaxing and intimate but way too loud - even for my 20 something daughter- when we asked if they could turn it down we were told no! Hotel lobby staff trying to be top drawer but a too stuffy and as such just did not connect- they need to look at the training for the JURY'S Hotels (Boston & Washington) and then it would have been perfect Great location to the theater area - we were there to see a show. And room just could not have been better

Reviews.Title: “Lacklustre”
Reviews.Author: southernbelle80
Reviews.Content: This hotel really nice in terms of the physical space and the rooms, regarding service I was expecting better. The room was fairly large and the bathroom was nice.The staff were mediocre overall - not very friendly and didn'te seem to enjoy their roles. We had a lot of problems with the hotel key - they couldn't figure out how to program it correctly so everytime we can back to our room we'd have to get a staff member to reset it. The small cafe/bistro had terrible service and the manager (blonde, average height female) was very rude. She rolled her eyes when we came in for lunch because we didn't have a reservation and said she'd "see what options there were because there were a couple of free tables." There were five free tables and we had lunch - in that time not another person came in so I don't see what the big deal was. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, felt pampered”
Reviews.Author: PCKramer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a Deluxe room for our wedding night and were told upon confirmation that we were being upgraded to a Luxury. Then at check-in, we were upgraded to a Premier room. On our last night, we arrived after a late evening out to find a bucket of champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries waiting for us with a sweet note of congratulations. I've stayed at many hotels with great service, but I've never felt so taken care of. The SoHo Met made sure to make our memorable weekend even more special. Regarding the details, the room was clean, quiet, and spacious. The view wasn't great (we were looking down onto Wayne Gretzky's sports bar), but at least we weren't facing a wall or anything horrible. The brunch offering at Senses didn't look appetizing, but the hotel is kitty corner to Cora's, which has a huge variety of healthy, hearty brunch dishes (prepare to line up on weekends). And it's worth noting that we saw two stars (one actor and one director) there, and everyone we encountered in the hallways and elevators were friendly and well-dressed. The SoHo clientele seem to be quite a classy bunch. And finally, its location is superb. Within walking distance of most tourist destinations and a short cab/transit ride to other Toronto hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....too bad we didn't get the full experience.”
Reviews.Author: Isis2121
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very excited to book a night's stay at the Soho. Every review we had read ensured a restful night in a swanky hotel. When we checked in on the Saturday of the July long weekend and saw our room (read: shoe closet) we were disappointed in every penny we spent. We regularly stay at other hotels in the city and while it may not be fair to compare the hotel to those with 5 star status, the service at the Soho was a joke! Our room was located directly across from the elevators on the 4floor and all night it sounded as though people were in our room! The Paper thin walls/door offered nothing by way of insulation and with the proximity of them in relation to our bed it is no surprise how much we could hear. We spoke to the front desk about changing rooms however, understandably as it was Caribana weekend, nothing could be done. While we are reasonable enough to understand that a fully booked hotel means weâ€™re staying put, the â€œgentlemanâ€� at the front desk was rude and smirked his way through our conversation â€“ leaves a bad taste when you can see management laughing at your misfortune in a room they are providing. No apologies, nothing. Wonâ€™t be staying here again and definitely not going to recommend. I must add however, the washroom is amazing! So if you do ever end up at the Soho, even if your room is tiny, the washroom will be the one saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Superb luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sawden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top end luxury, the service was fantastic and location was good for downtown Toronto, although to walk to the majority for shops and local Dundas Square was perhaps 30mins away. However the subway and street cars are readily available. The bed in the hotels was perhaps the most comfortable (and biggest) bed I have ever slept in! The bakery in the hotel was great and the service at the bar was great (however top end hotels have top end prices). The housekeeping in the hotel was great and so to was the technical features within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the SoHo”
Reviews.Author: BexRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the SoHo. It was elegant, very clean, quiet, and close to lots of attractions and restaurants. We did feel slightly out of place as we are a young couple on a casual vacation, and the hotel had a rich business man feel to it... We also heard another young group saying they felt so out of place... But, even though we felt out of place, the staff made us feel welcome...

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PHCDK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than 15 times since it opened and it remains one of my favorite hotels in the world, mostly because of the fantastic and personal service that is offered there. Rooms are very similar to the Hazelton, but I still prefer the atmosphere at the Soho which is a little more laid back. I even managed to stay there last year during the Juno Awards, fellow guests included Lady Gaga, Black Eyed Peas and Perez Hilton. I highly recommend the gym which is one of the better gyms I have had at a hotel (nearly up there with the gym at the St. Regis in SF). The bar is fine and so is the breakfast at Senses (do try the chocolate which comes from Thomas Haas).

Reviews.Title: “Slept so well!”
Reviews.Author: TVBelle
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the Soho Met in Toronto. Both times it has been for business. The first time was for four nights in the spring and this time was for 7 nights. It is a luxury class hotel and the services supports that ranking. The location of this hotel is fantastic if you're interested in walking to some of Toronto's more famous sites and neighborhoods. It's easy to get to the CN Tower, City Hall, the waterfront and Lakeshore areas, Chinatown, Queen Street, and the University of Toronto from the Soho Met. Walking in the neighborhoods around the hotel is safe and easy. The rooms are huge. And gorgeous. The beds are fantastic and truly I have never slept so well in a hotel. I particularly appreciate the bedside control panel for all the lights and the drapes in the room. No running around shutting things down--you just crawl under the duvet and control it all from bed. Wonderful. The heated floor in the bathroom is a fantastic feature. I did have trouble this stay with hot water not being reliable, but the courteous staff was attentive to the problem. There were a couple of little problems this stay that were handled efficiently by the staff. The hotel gym is very nice and has a lap pool in addition to cardio machines and plenty of weight lifting options. The hours for the weekend are inconvenient--but during the week the access is fairly good. Probably my only complaint about the hotel is the astronomical cost of room service considering the minimal portion sizes and the lower quality of food than what is served in the restaurant (at the same prices). The Senses restaurant in the hotel is quite delicious and it's suggested that the same food is offered for room service, but I don't find that to be true. The upcharge on room service is $5 per order plus a hefty service fee and there is nothing exceptional about it. For the prices they are charging, I would expect a higher quality meal with sides like bread and/or fruit and not just the one dish listed. Compared to say a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton room service presentation the Soho Met has a long way to go. Most of the time when I tried to reach room service during this most recent stay I got the voice mail. My colleague had a problem with room service the last time we were there as well. It seems to be more of an issue with dinner service than breakfast, as another colleague reported no issues or complaints with breakfast services. I just found it underwhelming and disappointing. Across the street from the hotel is a bistro called Pizza Rustica that offers delivery to the hotel and is 1/2 the price with a very good menu. Overall the stay at the Soho Met was wonderful and I look forward to a return trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: adeysh
Reviews.Content: This is one the most amazing hotels i have stayed in. The room was very spacious with extended tv area, It had ipod dock remote controlled curtains so my lazy bones didnt have to get up. The bathroom was all heated floors and had both tub and shower. They had wine and chocolates as i had booked valentines package. must stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not So "Hotel" Like”
Reviews.Author: LiveAmused
Reviews.Content: This is a good alternative for those tired of going through the formalities and impersonal feel of typical hotels. The location is good and near most attractions/University Ave./shopping/restaurants/etc. Hotel offers self parking at about 28 CAD in its covered garage. You park, take out your bags, take an elevator and arrive at hotel's lobby. The check in process was one of quickest ever and we were upgraded to a larger room. The hotel rooms are located at the first 5 or 6 floors and the remaining floors are condos. There is also a bar and breakfast/lunch cafe. The breakfast is OK but not great for the 25+ CAD. There are other coffee shops or breakfast choices nearby. Hotel offers a gym, steam room and indoor pool. The concierge is excellent and super friendly. Hotel car will take you to locations within a few miles of hotel. The rooms are spacious with modern decor and plenty of closet space. A great plus is complementary coffee/tea maker in room. This is not a glittery hotel but a very comfortable one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: coolny29
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice room, but not the best service. Terrible room service. Expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not bad... try to avoid the top floor, though.”
Reviews.Author: lakeheadcivileng
Reviews.Content: We just went down to Toronto for the weekend to do a bit of shopping and check out the Auto Show - this hotel is within just 10-15 minutes walking distance or a sub $10 cab ride to most things you'd want to get to in the down town area. The front desk staff was quite polite and the concierge was good about answering the few questions about directions I had. The room was quite nice - bed comfortable, nice desk area, large tv. Nice marble (or something similar) tiled bathroom with heated floors - can't complain about that. Something I haven't seen before as a hotel bathroom ammenity was a nice little bottle of mouthwash, which came in handy since I actually had forgotten mine - along with the usual fare. My only complaint about the place was the noise... it was nothing that kept me up, but if you are on the fourth floor, you may be subject to the loud ravings of the party going folk who are in the fancy loft above the main hotel rooms on the top floor. I could see if you had some extra loud idiots, you could be kept up all night. So if you need a good night's sleep, be sure to ask for a lower floor. Overall though, a nice hotel if you are looking for something more to the high end side of things.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Guests Above Me and Bad Service During the Day”
Reviews.Author: travelingsuperstar
Reviews.Content: A party was going on above me during my stay which was annoying as there are condo's above the hotel and some rowdy hotel guests. The lady concierge during the day was not helpful but the night staff Rommi and Dominic were very friendly, helpful and while they have less staff on at night, they were way more accommodating to my needs then the day staff who seemingly had less to do. The service is Day and Night, better at night. This hotel really needs a concierge staff that during the day can help with hot spots and things to do. I don't think they live in the city as they have no clue what is around the hotel or in the neighbourhood. I expected more from a boutique hotel, service at the big chains in this city offer better concierge details as I ended up leveraging the concierge from another hotel for restaurant reservations and tickets to a sporting event. I am looking forward to the Ritz Carlton and Thompson properties opening a block in either direction of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jumpinround
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the SoHo. THis hotel is within a condominium. It is nice and clean. The rooms are designed with modern design and minimalist emphasis. We were upgraded one level. We were on the second floor and it was noisy in the evening when the nearby bars closed. The bathrooms are beautiful with heated floors but no locks on the bathroom door. You can't beat the location for Toronto sights ie. Leafs and Jays games, entertainment district, dining in neighbouring restaurants, China Town, Exhibition place CN Tower, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: BluesDoctor
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy walk to the convention center, Chinatown, Kensington Market, Rogers Center and CN Tower. Very nice shopping and restaurants of all types near the hotel. Concierge service was outstanding, especially Nicholas, who went the extra mile by providing accurate information about the hotel and the general Toronto experience. Just for information's sake, parking is $30/ day and don't forget your wallet if you have drinks at the Senses Bar. Also, if you learn the walking subway system, known as the PATH, your time and exposure to the elements will be lessened when walking to other hotels, restaurants and the Eaton Center.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel!! Nice bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: edradour2000
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure at staying at this downtown hotel on business. I was blown away by the personal greeting by the doorman, the front desk staff and the great little bar and restaurant. The rooms are very spacious and the bathroom is out of this world. Heated marble floors, glass shower and soaker tub.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern boutique hotel in downtown financial area”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: For those of you who want a smaller, mor modern boutique type hotel as a change from the larger, more traditional, less hip hotels, this is the place to go. It also has an excellent restaurant on site. The room was large, modern and chic. Bathrooms are awesome - they have heated marbel floors, lots of toiletries (Molton Brown) and amenities. The windows have automated shades. TV is a nice large flat panel. and the closet area is huge. Nice size safe. Wifi signal was ok - sometimes it was weak. Air conditioning was being tested to its limits when i was there - wasnt quite cool enough. Hallways seemed to be un-air conditioned which wasnt great when in a suit. Concierge and door staff were very helpful. Hadnt bee back to thishotel in a few years but it was like going home again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: crsdmale
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel is amazingly comvenient to most of Toronto's main attractions. The CN Tower, Rogers Center, and waterfront are all within easy walking distance. From the moment of our arrival we were spoiled by the attentive and courteous service. At check-in we were advised that we were being upgraded due to the length of our stay (3 nights). Although we arrived much earlier than standard check-in, the process was quick and efficient and a room was ready upon our arrival. We were escorted to our room and given a demonstration of the amenities, of which the room had many. Throughout our stay, the hotel staff were always courteous and helpful and greeted us every time we returned from our various outings. The hotel was very clean and comfortable without sacrificing style. It covered any need you could possibly have down to a complimentary umbrella in the room for the unpredictable Toronto weather. We would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to our return to Toronto just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Catherine19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our honeymoon. We were given a room upgrade upon check in and strawberries were left in our room, which was a nice touch. Our room was very spacious and well appointed. The service was fantastic, staff at reception were very helpful and there was a turndown service each evening. The hotel is in a great position for exploring the city, it's very close to the CN tower. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel - always a pampering treat! :)”
Reviews.Author: I-Do-World-Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night to see a concert in downtown Toronto and it was wonderful. I have stayed here on a few occassions and whenever I do, I always feel pampered thus it is a real treat. I was in a deluxe king bed. The staff were helpful, friendly and accommodating. The electronic blinds and do not disturb button provide nice, modern convenience. They have a nice little clock radio that provides soothing sound options as well as a small selection of songs and a built in i-pod connection for your own music. The TV is a large screen and the headboard is padded. The closet is a large walk in area with plenty of storage. The bathroom is one of the finer points as it is all marble (with heated floors) and a glass enclosed shower with great water pressure. The room is not large but with an office desk and the entertainment unit, it is sufficient. I often have trouble sleeping in hotels due to noise waking me (even through earplugs) but I find this hotel is nice and quiet. You also have a window that opens. They allowed me a late check out at 3pm so that was great. There is a mini bar but I move things out to use it for my own beverages. I had room service and the spaghetti bolognese was a little dry in that there is more meat than sauce and the noodles were al dente. The home made chocolate cookies tasted more like chocolate than cookie. That was $44 for pasta and cookies (incl tax/tip). I recommend the breakfast as was quite yummy with real potatoes and real orange juice. It was $37 (incl tax/tip) and it included juice and coffee. Internet service is included and you have wi-fi or dsl option. Note, parking is an extra $30 with in/out access and that price is rather common downtown. The location is great as it is right across from the Rogers centre with lots of restaurants and bars within close proximity. Every time I have gone I have missed the pool (this time was closed for maintenance and although the next day it was available, I opted for a bath instead). If I could change anything about this hotel it would be that I would want a larger tub as although the marble enclosure is large the tub is just a bit larger than regular size. I also would like it if the fan was more powerful as the halogen and vanity lighting put off a lot of heat thus I find the washroom is always warm when I am trying to get ready. I would also opt for a better matress. Their's is certainly sufficient and it was quite comfy however it is not as nice as the ones at the Marriott (which have my favourite). Also, I like that their pillows are a good size and there are four however I would prefer if they had a couple of feather options instead of the foam that they use. Overall it is my favourite place to stay in Toronto and it is better than most places I have stayed at in North America other than world class resorts. I think it is a little pricey but when you consider the service level and how luxurious it is, it is well worth it and I know that in comparison to other hotels in the area, it is a much better value for what you get. Compare discounted weekend rate of $215 with low end hotels such as Travel Lodge and Super 8 that are going for about $150 there is zero comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: rachelhannah1996
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of my Summer Vactaion my freind and I singed up for an art camp at the Ontaior College of Art. My family lives in Markham (40 mins. away from the city) and the commute to Toronto was quite long on the working days, so my mom (age 40) decided to stay at the SoHo Metropolitan for a few nights and during the day look in the area for an urban cottage (a condo). Pros: The SoHo was walking distance of OCAD/AGO, Queen Street (great shopping), China Town, CN Tower and the Skydome (formally known as the Rogers Center). The SoHo is also a condo complex, with a seperate entrance and lobby. The concearge showed my mom some beautiful units and also gave us a chance to explore the SoHo's penthouse where Canda's Next Top Model was filmed and many celebs (such as Justin Timberlake, Usher, Black Eyed Peas, Pink and Lady Gaga) have stayed. However we had a 1 bedroom suite which was very luxurious and acceptable for my high standards. My friend and I went to spa/fitness center complex to use their pool/hottub, which was decent. Cons: the pool/hottub was not salt water and the complentary transportation service was overbooked forcing us to use a taxi I'd like to add that our concierge was amazing and was on task. We were very lucky to have him during our stay, and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: esqEsq
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Very nice room, at a good rate (had it for less than $200 US per night on expedia). Well located for downtown Toronto, in King West area which is growing its development -- lots of very nice King St west restaurants nearby. We generally prefer to be at the Four Seasons or Park Hyatt as they are at Avenue and Bloor Streets, but, our first stay at the Soho Met would lead us to consider it carefully on our next stay in Toronto. Staff was very nice, and helpful. Music in the bar was a bit loud, but otherwise an excellent experience. Our room was consistent with the photos illustrated on the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel very nice”
Reviews.Author: Scrumble
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Definitely a luxury. Close to King st restaurants, MEC, and a block away from the skydome. Turn down service was nice, heated bathroom floors, soft towels, electronic drapes, mini bar. Gym had good equipment but was small and shared with the residents of the building. <-- only the bottom 4 floors are for the hotel, the rest is condos. Apples in the lobby for free. Free internet, fitness centre, and pool. Bakery/breakfast is small and pricey ($25 for buffet). We went directly across the street for a VERY good breakfast at a very decent price (the name of the place had pizza in it). We asked for an early check-in and check out and got both. Overall, it was a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury defined.”
Reviews.Author: MyDogForPresident
Reviews.Content: After a highly stressful and tumultuous few weeks, my husband thought of treating us to an overnight stay in this luxurious hotel. We've had the pleasure of staying at some very high end resorts and none come close to providing the level of service that we enjoyed at this hotel. Appart from the accommodations themselves, which were wonderful, the true spirit of the hotel is in the personal attention one receives by its staff. They define luxury. I can't say enough about our stay here. We were welcomed at every level with the utmost respect and friendliness, anyone we spoke to was ready and happy to offer assistance for anything from helping with baggage to making dinner reservations, etc. A fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - but help with the tech”
Reviews.Author: texanchef
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights mid week and landed a multi-night discount. The rooms are as beautiful as the website show. However, the technology is sorely lacking. The Wi-Fi in the rooms is poor and moving to the looby / cafe does not improve your odds of maintaining a connection. The only solution is good old fashioned ethernet. The bathrooms are quite luxurious with both a shower / tub and heated floors. The closets are immense - bigger than some apartments! The other issueis the heavy sunscreens. Its difficult to raise and lower; the maids complained about the pull chais constantly breaking. The hotel is very convenient to the West End restaurants and Tram. Its a 5 block walk to the subway. PS Ask for a room that faces the inner courtyard for maximum peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay- Do not hesitate”
Reviews.Author: MNBruhaha
Reviews.Content: Pros: - newer, spacious clean hotel room with all the perks you would expect from a luxury hotel - bathrooms are fantastic- mostly granite with marble accents and glass shower enclosure and spacious bathtub, flat screen TV with motorized curtain. - close to all the downtown attractions: CN tower, Rogers Centre, Dining, Toronto Islands, etc. - very quiet Cons: - $250 a night which I would say is very reasonable for a hotel of this caliber in the best part of the largest city in Canada,

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Fragilityg4
Reviews.Content: This hotel blew us away. We stayed here on our wedding night as our honeymoon was to be at a later date and we could not believe how wonderful this place was! Full marble heated bathroom floors, 550sq ft room, wardrobe area etc. The staff was extremely polite from the booking (through email) to our check out. On our second night, after returning from dinner, they had gave us champagne, chocolate strawberries and put on some romantic music to play throughout the room. You might pay a bit more here ... but in the end you get a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “Love SoHo”
Reviews.Author: Gobyboat
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The SoHo Met on several occasions. I always enjoy every moment. The rooms are spotless and stylishly contemporary. Sen5es restaurant offers great in-room dining. The staff is always helpful and friendly. I love the Dale Chihuly glass sculpture as you enter the lobby. The hotel is located within a short distance of the popular King West/Queen West villages filled with funky shopping and dining, the CN Tower and harbour, the convention center, Chinatown or the Theater district.

Reviews.Title: “A special stay at the splendid SoHo”
Reviews.Author: Homat
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the SoHo's rather unique residential section for seven months after returning to Canada from many years in Asia. It certainly wasn't the least expensive extended stay accommodation in town, but we didn't mind paying a premium for what we came to be convinced is by far the best hotel service quality in Toronto. The staff â€“ which made every effort to get to know us personally â€“ is really terrific: friendly people, interesting personalities, well-trained, articulate and intelligent, responsive plus prompt. Indeed, speed is one special stand-out characteristic of the SoHo: anything we asked for â€“ no matter how difficult or unusual â€“ was dealt with in an ultra-fast solutions-focused manner. This was just one of the ways in which we felt that the SoHo team â€“ which seemed to suffer low turnover during our long stay â€“ went the extra mile to let us know that our business was valued, and this attitude extended from junior entry-level staff to the senior management of the property. A couple of other positive points worth noting: the bright Senses bakery has a great breakfast with fresh, high quality food (including fun touches like dim sum); the vibrant Senses â€˜scene barâ€™ makes the best martini in Toronto and the people who work there are off-the-scale when it comes to providing sophisticated service; and the engineering/ maintenance team is the best Iâ€™ve seen in any hotel (they know how to fix just about anything and even assembled our toddler sonâ€™s baby crib). While the SoHo is clearly a trendy and â€˜coolâ€™ modern property, even though we had a baby in tow nobody gave us a negative vibe and we would describe the hotel as family-friendly. About the only discordant note from our stay was the lack of attention to detail on some billing matters but this didnâ€™t detract from our overall positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLover129
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff very courteous and nice. Nice lobby and the bakery was good. If you book the luxury, the 450sqf half is the bathroom, nicest bathroom I have ever seen. Highly reccomend, especially if going to Rogers Centre.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicknesta
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel . i was here on business and the hotel is a nice home away from home. Bedroom is great and bathrrom is wonderfull with a great bath and walk in shower. I have stayed here many times and cannot recommend it highly enough. I will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACanadianguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a quick weekend getaway to Toronto and chose the Soho Metropolitan based on previous experience with this facility. We arrived at the hotel at 11 am and were allowed to check in early - a big plus for us, since the weather was cold, wet and rainy and we appreciated the opportunity to get settled before braving the outdoors. Check-in was swift and the service was pleasant without being overbearing. The room was very comfortable and both of us appreciated the wide-screen TV, the well-appointed bathroom and the firm but comfortable bed. Our room package included a bottle of sparkling wine, which we enjoyed after returning to the hotel from dinner. The next morning, we had breakfast at Cora's, which is located just across the street and offers an excellent assortment of breakfast options. This hotel is a little off the beaten track for those who want to be close to the shopping in Yorkville or to the museums, but it makes up for it in comfort and unpretentious service. Next time, we'll be back and we'll bring our bathing suits to enjoy the pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with cold styling + mediocre warmth @ front desk”
Reviews.Author: jonze
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel with comfortable beds and clean rooms. Like most boutique hotels, it's a bit over-priced for what you get, but it served my purpose and the location doesn't put you out in a seedy part of town or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Lesslyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a relaxing night in at a hotel in our own city. This was the perfect place. The room had a king sized bed, a huge window, a flat screen tv and a beautiful marble bathroom. The turndown service and selection of pillows was lovely. We ordered room service, not expecting much, and had an amazing meal. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the duvet and sheets were incredibly soft. A great escape.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely impeccable”
Reviews.Author: wacky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SoHo Met 2 nights â€“ first night with my girlfriends to relax and pretty up for my wedding and the second with my new husband on our wedding night. Originally I wanted to book the new Hazelton Hotel for uber luxury, but it was a bit far from our wedding venue on King Street and downtown traffic was the last stress I needed! We chose SoHo for proximity, design, luxury, privacy and service. We did compromise on view -- parking lot is not so sexy though our room had a good view of the CN tower -- but none of the waterfront hotels could compare with what SoHo offered anyway. (As a Torontonian we had the luxury of touring several hotels prior to making out selection) Our stay was absolutely impeccable. Fresh orchids, large suite, plush robes and slippers, ridiculously comfortable bed, Molton Brown seamoss hydrosoak salts, yuan zhi sleep mist, complimentary bottles of water replenished daily, and most memorably the top notch service, from the bellman to the GM, pre-check in to post-check out. We did not use the kitchen but it was well stocked. The only thing I would have liked to have is a larger bathroom with Jacuzzi tub. I would recommend SoHo to the most discerning traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M747
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Friendly service and Large rooms and bathroom. No Flat Screen tv, but You cant get them all

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Heated Marble Floors!”
Reviews.Author: CATrvl08
Reviews.Content: Fabulous service that was evident upon check-in. I stayed in a Luxury room which had a nice closet built in for storing and luggage. The bathroom was very luxurious- heated marble floors, pretty impressive. The only drawback was the view of the parking lot across the street. Senses for dinner was great- they whipped up a 7 course vegetarian tasting menu for me without notice- this usually requires advance notice to the restaurant. Senses bakery for breakfast was tasty as well. Concierge arranged car service, etc with no problems. Great stay- I will return next time I am in Toronto.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
Reviews.Title: “A true five star experience!”
Reviews.Author: espengc
Reviews.Content: This is the best place we have ever stayed. We had a executive suite with a modern fully equipped kitchen. A minimalistic decorated living room. Bedroom with a bed we would like to take home and a nice (if not a bit small) bathroom with great bath products; ever tried marshmallow mouth wash? If not it is time to try it!! All products replaced every day. Fresh flowers in the apartment every day. The staff professional, if not a bit cold; thanks to Irene who gave recommendations on where to go and what to see. Senses bar, restaurant and bakery on the premises. Reservation made through the hotel. Nikki made her very best effort to give us the apartment and thanks to her we ended up in Soho. The hotel is close to Chinatown and the CN tower and Rogers center. A nice walk to the waterfront and the Steamwhistle brewery. Make a stop on the way down and back from the waterfront on the brewery. Free sampling and the best Toronto lager. Some restaurants close to the hotel. Coras is a good stop for breakfast. The only downside to the apartment must be that it was difficult to leave it during our one week stay to actually experience Toronto and all it has to offer. Thanks to the Tripadvisor Toronto forum for all your help prior to our stay. Recommend all travellers going to Toronto to use the forum!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kecoco
Reviews.Content: So I was a little nervous about staying at the Soho Metropolitan in Toronto. There had been mixed reviews about the location and the views over a parking lot. The hotel website has only a few photos so I did not know what to expect. Check-in was efficient we were told that we had been upgraded to a luxury room from a deluxe.......fanstastic. We get to the room and based upon room descriptions on their website the room was a lower level than we booked instead of an upgrade. Fortunately the front desk caught their mistake immediately and called the room to let us know that was not the room we should have been given.........yeah!. Our new room was 550 sq. ft of beautiful sleek subdued space with a dressing room covered in maple veneer and an enormous perfectly designed bathroom with good lighting. Staff were young and appeared to be a little inexperienced but what they lacked in experience they made up with politeness and helpfulness. The location worked for us.....easy walk to most places and only a few blocks from a subway stop. I would definitely recommend this hotel Please note that the Senses cafe serves a european type buffet breakfast in the morning and is kind of pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Crap, at it's finest!”
Reviews.Author: aquaholic78
Reviews.Content: .... this was my honeymoon - we requested a quiet stay, so we were put on the 'Serenity Floor' .. however, a few hours later, realized, the GYM was ABOVE the Serenity Floor. We could hear people runnign on treadmills, which was pounding through the ceilings .. and free weights being dropped. Needless to say, we checked out a few hours later. With no apology, and we took a taxi to the Fairmount, which was great. What a crappy start to my HONEYMOON! UGH!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your hotel again and see Dirty Dancing again...”
Reviews.Author: TinaWelland
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the courtesy of your staff, the quick and friendly service they provide and the comfortable, spacious, very clean rooms. Trevor Francis had reserved our rooms for the evening when we attended Dirty Dancing last Tuesday. It is a fact that the first impression is a lasting impression...I had not taken two steps off the elevator in the lobby of your hotel that a very friendly lady came towards me from behind the concierge desk and asked if she could help. I indicated I was coming to register and immediately a gentleman, I think his name was Chris, took my suitcase and my clothes bag and directed me to the registration desk. Within 5 - 8 minutes I had the key to my room and was escorted to Room 211. I received a thorough explanation regarding switches and amenities. I really, really was impressed and will definitely book at Soho again when I need a hotel in Toronto. THANK YOU! Please convey my congratulations to your staff for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “I usually pick a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Susan99
Reviews.Content: For some reason this little hotel just called my name - - and I'm so glad I stayed there. I think it was the heated bathroom floor that caught my fancy, but the bed was the real star - - and for me, that's when I know I'm at a quality hotel. The bed was beyond fabulous, and linens were luxurious. The clock radio is also a docking station for an i-pod. The bathroom is super, a beautiful tub for relaxing after a stressful drive, and a great shower to get started for the next day! When I returned to the hotel in the evening, the turn-down service had been done, there was quiet classical music playing, drapes drawn, and a complimentary bottle of water by the bed. The hotel was generally quiet until about 8:45 AM when a cacophony of doors slamming suddenly started up and in many cases it seemed to be the same door! Housekeeping should be more aware of that sound than they appeared to be. Check-in was easy, the concierge was very attentive and good at his job. The view was so-so but I could see the CN Tower! Location-wise it's easy to get to off the Gardiner Expressway and after a 6 hour drive in high winds, that's exactly what I needed!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Heiress23
Reviews.Content: Found a super deal online for a rate of $100/night at the SoHo Met -- couldn't believe what I was seeing, so i double checked and sure enough, found the same deal through the hotel's direct website. Obviously, i booked it right away and cancelled the previous booking I had with another great hotel nearby. Confirmation was sent to me and I thought all was fine and dandy until in-house reservations called me the next day to tell me there was a "mistake" with the rate they had advertised. The package deal was really supposed to be $485/night but as "compensation" they would be willing to offer me the same room for $200 -- that's double the price i was expecting to pay and excluding the rest of the package details. WHAT ON EARTH?! For a swanky, "5-star" hotel, i was appalled by management's handling of this situation. They should have been able to honour their adverisement and cut their losses, considering the profit they are making on a regular basis (approx $300/night for a regular stay) and the fact that it was THEIR mistake, rectified a day too late. It's really too bad, because i was supposed to book a week's stay for some high-end clients in town next month but will no longer do so at the Soho Met.

Reviews.Title: “My New Toronto Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Spamstan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Soho Metropolitan on a business trip. Great experience. I will be back. The service was top notch. I checked in after midnight and the front desk staff was friendly and alert, unlike other hotels I've stayed in and done late night check in. I was fortunate enough to be bumped to a premium room, which was more than I needed but of course quite welcome. Nice sitting area, good work space, comfortable bed. Huge bathroom that included heated floors, a nice touch. Flat panel TV (a new hotel standard) with DVD player. Almost seemed a shame to leave and go to the office. Breakfast was a buffet in the attached bakery/coffee stand. It wasn't terribly busy, but still service was prompt. Food was fine. The bar was pretty lively early in the evening, part of the reason being that it was also the waiting area for their restaurant. Later that evening the paced had slowed down considerably. Location is great - right in the core, walking distance or short cab ride from most things you'd need or want to do. Airport is about 20 mins by cab in no traffice (considerably longer in traffic). They do have a nice exercise facility but I wasn't able to take advantage of it. It's not open 24 hours, which is a drawback. Overall it's a hotel I will look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique experience”
Reviews.Author: myp22202
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel with luxury amenities in rooms. Many rooms are almost too large, seeming cavernous to the business traveler. Wireless connection was not great, but manageable. Service is excellent, especially concierge. Room service/restaurant is very fancy, but I found it to be more show than substance. Heated floors in bathrooms are very nice touch for winter seasons.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Alison297
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel to stay in, excellent service, beautiful rooms, amazing bathrooms. Best to sign up to preferred hotel group then you get the best rate and are more likely to be upgraded to superior room like we did. The front desk staff could not be more helpful. They found us a table on New Year's Eve for 6 of us at a very top Italian restaurant. The sen5es coffee shop did a lovely breakfast buffet, amazing granola yoghurt muesli. Delicious cakes and pastries. Would highly recommend and would have no hesitation about staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: calidragon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Metropolitan several times and this last one was probably the least satisfying. First off, i made the mistake of staying in a suite which is less desirable than their king rooms. It actually seems like less space and is considerably more money. Our room was overlooking the alley way which during the weekend is quiter but early Monday morning all the garbage trucks come to collect the weekend trash and is noisy to say the least. The mini bar was not restocked. The bar added their own tip on top of mine, toilettries were not restocked either. All in all a nice place but certainly not worth the money and no much more than 3 star service. Will try another hotel next trip to Toronto...

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, luxe choice”
Reviews.Author: clydethetraveller
Reviews.Content: In short, my favorite place to stay in Toronto given the combination of luxe rooms, good service and location Pros: - super, large bathrooms -- very luxurious, spacious and comfortable with great products (Molton Brown) - luxe, minimalist rooms (the color palette is very neutral and there is no extra clutter, but the bed is very comfortable, the draper open by remote control, and the room is very well maintained) - good service (not really up to Four Seasons standard, but tend to be very friendly and well-meaning) - great gym (but closes much too early at 10:30) - excellent food at the Senses bakery (too die for coffee and pastries) Cons: - most rooms lack a good view or great light as the hotel is on the low floors of a condo building - not directly attached to Toronto's underground PATH system (it's a short walk to the PATH, but in winter you really appreciate the direct connection -- however, the hotels that are directly attached (Fairmont, Sheraton, Hilton aren't worth the benefit)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but our stay was ruined by noise”
Reviews.Author: SC_Bflo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. Very clean room and common area. Modern decor, attractive, good amenities in the rooms. Fitness center has good equipment, but was a little on the small side. We did not check out the pool. Service was great. Every person we encountered that worked their was helpful and polite. Turndown service every night, provided fresh towels and bottled water on the night stand. Problem: Our room #220 was located above the lobby. The first night we were in town, we were awakened at 2:30 am by people in the street outside the restaurant entrance. They were waiting for a taxi, were inebriated and very loud. The second night we were awakened by drunks at 4:30 am. For over $300 a night, it is unexcusable that a hotel would rent us a room basically on top of the taxi stand. It is really too bad, because this could have been a great trip. If you stay there make sure you are on an upper floor, away from the lobby entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dmpls79
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for 4 nights but only stayed here at the SOHO Metropolitan for 2 and stayed at the Pantages for the other 2 nights. SOHO costed twice as much and to me was much more well worth it than Pantages. Stayed in the luxury Rooms, exactly like the pictures, rooms super cleans, beautiful bathroom, and ALL the staff were wonderful, fast checkin/checkout. When doorman was there and not helping anyone else, they opened the door for us and greeted us each time. The first day we arrived after bringing the luggage to our room, we decided to walk to CN towers (2-3 blocks away) , and it was raining a little bit and had forgotten the umbrella in the car. As we were walking out of the elevator the doorman noticed us heading outside and he rushed to grab an umbrella for us and opened the door for us. We never even had to ASK for an umbrella. Bottled water and ice everynight for turndown service. Best experience ever, will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, sleek luxury”
Reviews.Author: CA78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July, 2007. The best rate I could find was on the hotel's website. We arrived on the VIA railway from Montreal, and walked the 5 or 6 blocks to the hotel.
